azurerm_kubernetes_cluster_node_pool.description: Manages a Node Pool within a Kubernetes Cluster

name.description: The name of the Node Pool which should be created within the Kubernetes Cluster. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
name.notes: A Windows Node Pool cannot have a `name` longer than 6 characters.

kubernetes_cluster_id.description: The ID of the Kubernetes Cluster where this Node Pool should exist. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

vm_size.description: The SKU which should be used for the Virtual Machines used in this Node Pool. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

availability_zones.description: A list of Availability Zones where the Nodes in this Node Pool should be created in.

enable_auto_scaling.notes: Additional fields must be configured depending on the value of this field - see below.

enable_node_public_ip.description: Should each node have a Public IP Address? Defaults to `false`.

max_pods.description: The maximum number of pods that can run on each agent. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

node_labels.description: A map of Kubernetes labels which should be applied to nodes in this Node Pool.

node_taints.description: A list of Kubernetes taints which should be applied to nodes in the agent pool (e.g `key=value:NoSchedule`).

os_disk_size_gb.description: The Agent Operating System disk size in GB. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

os_type.description: The Operating System which should be used for this Node Pool. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. Possible values are `Linux` and `Windows`. Defaults to `Linux`.

tags.description: A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

vnet_subnet_id.description: The ID of the Subnet where this Node Pool should exist.
vnet_subnet_id.notes: At this time the `vnet_subnet_id` must be the same for all node pools in the cluster

max_count.description: The maximum number of nodes which should exist within this Node Pool. Valid values are between `1` and `100` and must be greater than or equal to `min_count`.

min_count.description: The minimum number of nodes which should exist within this Node Pool. Valid values are between `1` and `100` and must be less than or equal to `max_count`.

node_count.description: The number of nodes which should exist within this Node Pool. Valid values are between `1` and `100`.

id.description: The ID of the Kubernetes Cluster Node Pool.

create.description: Used when creating the Kubernetes Cluster Node Pool.

update.description: Used when updating the Kubernetes Cluster Node Pool.

read.description: Used when retrieving the Kubernetes Cluster Node Pool.

delete.description: Used when deleting the Kubernetes Cluster Node Pool.
